weather_report:
This evening in Downtown San Francisco, the atmosphere embraces a muted, tranquil charm as rain whispers its impending arrival. The clouds hang like a soft gray blanket overhead, only hinting at the city’s more vibrant hues, while gentle breezes weave through the streets. With temperatures resting comfortably around 56 degrees, a light jacket or an umbrella proves wise, the kind of protection that allows you to wander without worry as nature prepares to drench the ground. The forecast hints at a 70% chance of rain, teasing the promise of soothing drops that might wash away the remnants of the day.

As we look toward tomorrow with its slight chance of rain after 4 PM, the clouds will continue to grace us with their presence, tapering off into a high of 62 degrees. A seasoned San Franciscan might find it prudent to layer up; after all, the air takes on a chill as the afternoon drifts toward evening. With the subtle play of fog that dances along the bay, consider a quiet stroll through one of the city's cozy neighborhoods, where the charm of a warm café or the company of a good book beckons. Tonight, as the city lights begin to twinkle like distant stars, many will find comfort in the simple pleasures of home, perhaps accompanied by the aromas of a warm meal and the soft sounds of rain tapping against the window.
